reviews.review_msg: One of the best profs at SFU. She's adorable and cares lots about all of her students. Class average was an A. You will have to review the materials before and after class because it is very fast paced, but she gives lots of worksheets and materials for review. I would recommend this course to anyone regardless if you have an italian background.
She is the loveliest prof ever. I absolutely recommend taking Italian courses with her.

Very nice professor. There are so much things to cover in this class, and she tried and did manage to teach material pretty well in only couple months. She is super helpful when you visit during her office hours.  You do need to study and review material every day in order to succeed in this course.. Grammar part is little tricky, but manageable.
Chohre is definitely one of my favourite professors at SFU! She's very helpful and responds to emails. Very fair assignments and exams.

Took this as an intersession course. Definitely need to show up to class. But it was great. She's adorable and really cares about the students. She won't take marks off quizzes if everyone chose something that she thinks is obvious in an Italian point of view.   Best class I've taken in my SFU career.

She is a very helpful teacher, very passionate of what she is doing. Sometimes she plays an Italian song and funny video to wake the class up. However, there are a lot of online assignment to keep you going. Be prepared to review the text everyday! I have taken both Japanese and Italian at SFU.i like ITAL more since she is teaching it:)

She's such a good prof - a cute little old Italian lady! She's kind of funny and loves to talk about Italy. Sometimes she's unclear, but it's because things that are really obvious to her in Italian might be confusing to us. Fast paced. Fun. 100% textbook use. All online assignments. Available for help. Understanding. Loved this course!

In this class, we had to cover 7 chapters in a few 4 months. The pace was EXTREMELY fast. To do well, you must review the material everyday. If you do not do this, you will be lost. This is not a class I would recommend to someone without any prior background in Italian. Be prepared to dedicate a lot of your time to this class.

A very nice woman.  She uses the text for everything.  Sometimes a little harsh when you make a beginners mistake in class.  Encourages a lot of participation but it is a language course.. so expected.
LOVE this teacher. She is so nice and helpful. I'm planning to take the rest of the Italian courses offered, i hope she is teaching them.

She is the best teacher anyone can ask for:)  She is clear in her teaching, she can be approached and you'll be treated with kindness and consideration!  She has a clear passion about her teachiing and her students, and about Italy... obviously one of the reasons why she is absolutely the best teacher.

Very nice and understanding. Always willing to help students understand. Passionate about Italy and the language, and helpful not only in teaching the language, but teaching the culture of Italy. I would recommend this class to everyone.
very very nice teacher. very helpful and understanding.
Such a sweet teacher - not intimidating whatsoever, very helpful and understanding. Fun class!
